name: Pixels And Polygons: An Indie Game Developer Story
blurb: Pixels And Polygons is a self shot documentary about a studios rough journey to it's big game debut at the PAX East 2013 expo.

rewards.reward: Every dollar counts! For this contribution you will get my sincere thanks! Seriously, I'll put up a large "wall of thanks" on the GameStarrArts website(when it launches) with everyone's name on your own badge for all who contributed, all the way down to even $1. Every little bit shows me that people cared to see this all come to light.

Every $5 will receive their name on the "wall of thanks" and get a pre-order of Pro Janitor Police, with the exclusive "Mop of Truth" bonus weapon for Kickstarter contributers only! Coming out in June! A sincere thanks and a game with an awesome exclusive weapon addition = $5 well spent.

Here's where things get interesting. On top of being on the "wall of thanks" and a pre-order download of Pro Janitor Police(with exclusive weapon!), you will get a digital download, extended version of the documentary with extra interviews and footage. The extended documentary is approximately 1 hour and 45 minutes(45 minutes longer), and includes several new interviews with members from the company and the game industry, as well as new footage not seen in the free version of the film.

Stackable rewards! Gotta love em! For $20, you'll get all the previous rewards, PLUS free purchase codes for our next 3 games with exclusive Kickstarter content(TBA), all slated to release before the end of the year. So that's 4 games, plus a digital download extended version of the film, and your name on the wall of thanks AND the special thanks film credits, along with the peace of mind that you helped out some starving artists trying to change the world. What could be better?

Here's the awesome one. For $50, you will get all previous rewards(of course), and a packaged version of the documentary  with extended interviews and footage on DVD, in special packaging, with a large form special exclusive art book enclosed, featuring game art and more from Daniel Worley and Richard Cook, with a personal signed thank you note. This is a very personal thank you for believing in us.

The creators reward! What could be better than saying you contributed a piece of art or a song to a videogame?! For a $100 contribution, you will receive all previous rewards, and we will feature your art or music in a game of ours! If you are not an artist or composer, we will discuss a similar opportunity.

We will contact you when we are ready to use your content in game, and you will be credited in the game as a guest artist or composer. 

Guidelines to follow include no profanity or explicit art, and all submissions will be regulated at the discretion of the company before being published in game.

The learners reward! Some of us could all use a little helping hand sometimes. For this HUGE contribution, you'll receive all previous rewards, along with (5) private tutoring sessions with myself, Richard Cook of GameStarrArts. Whether you are learning 3D, 2D, or just want to discuss general game industry knowledge or happenings, you will have (5) 3 hour sessions of my personal assistance for anything you are working on or interested in. I will even create a training curriculum for you based on consulting of the first session. Scheduling can be negotiated, and sessions will be conducted via Skype.

The gift of greatness! Since I would be blown away if anyone decided to contribute this much money to my cause, I would definitely have to repay in kind. With all of the above rewards of course, if you happen to have your own project, be it a film, a game, a show, anything.. I'll contribute my talents in any way I can. I'll create custom art for you, I'll play a part in your project, I'll even do the worm(yes I can actually do that).. anything to extend my gratitude for such a belief in my ideas. We'll talk, and we'll figure out how I can make your contribution just!
